comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

reviewing web server log, has lots of entries of the following form:

Argument "\x{ff11}" isn't numeric in numeric comparison (<=>) at /var/www/html/bugs/Bugzilla/Install/Util.pm line 504.

Not sure whether these are triggered by a search or just looking at a bug (I think its the latter).

unicode ff11, ff12 etc are "full size 0, 1 ..."   
Investigating my installation of BZ, I do indeed have products where the version fields were filled in with these values

Version: １．００, 1.00ｒｃ２, 1.00ｒｃ１ 

This is probably by accident, so I can find and fix these.


Actual results:

Bug search or bug viewing causes the above message to appear in the apache web server error log.


Expected results:

probably, vers_cmp should be able to handle unicode text in the version field without erroring.
